Proudly serving over 2,000 students in central Brooklyn
Fast Facts
Coronavirus (COVID-19) Updates and Resources
Updated on April 7, 2020
Dear Explore Families,
Explore Schools will be on a modified spring break as planned from April 10th to April 17th. During this time, students are not expected to attend remote instruction, however, materials and videos will be provided through Google Classroom from their teachers. Additional activities for students and families will be shared on our Continued Learning Website.
Updated on April 2, 2020
Dear Explore Families,
Please join us for our Kindergarten lottery on Monday April 6th. The lottery will take place virtually.
Join us by clicking the link below.
Explore Schools Kindergarten Lottery
Updated on March 27, 2020
Dear Explore Families,
The New York City Department of Health (DOHMH) recently released a new frequently asked questions document (FAQ) on COVID-19 for parents and caregivers of preschool and school-age children. You can find the document at the link below.
https://www1.nyc.gov/assets/doh/downloads/pdf/imm/covid-19-school-children-faq.pdf
Updated on March 20, 2020
Dear Explore Families,
We are missing you dearly, but excited about the opportunity to continue to connect with you on our continued learning platform. As we head into the weekend, we want to share some updates that may be useful to you next week.
Continued Learning Plan
Please continue to visit Explore Schools Continuing Education Website where you will find our continued learning plan as well as well as resources to support learning at home. On the site you will find:
Home Learning – assignments shared by your child’s teachers, as well as strategies we hope you find useful for home learning
Family Resources – resources to address your most pressing questions
Activities – online activities your child can do outside of school work
Please note that we will continue to update the site with current information and resources. Check back frequently!
Grab and Go Meals
Starting on Monday March 23rd, grab and go meals will only be available at 439 sites.
Please find the list of sites here: NYCDOE Meal Grab and Go Locations
Please note that these sites may change over time. We will notify you if there are any changes
Other relevant information:
Any students 18 and under may go to any of these sites to pick up one breakfast and two lunch meals.
Breakfast and lunch will be available for grab and go from 7:30am-1:30pm.
Grab and go meals will distributed by school food staff members.
The grab and go meals will be distributed at the main building entrance.
At the moment: students will only be able to pick up one day’s worth of meals (one breakfast and two lunch meals).
Regional Education Centers (RECs)
In order to successfully fight COVID-19, our first responders, health care providers, transit workers, and other key personnel must be able to come to work. That is why we have created Regional Enrichment Centers (RECs)—places where the children of these front-line workers can be safely cared for while their parents continue to serve the city in this time of need. Staffed by DOE employees and community-based organization partners, the centers will provide children with three hot meals daily, remote learning time with their teachers, activities like art and music, and social and emotional support. Regional Enrichment Centers will be available citywide.
Eligible parents can complete the survey here: Regional Education Centers Survey
Updated March 16, 2020
Dear Explore Schools Families,
Beginning March 16, the New York City Department of Education will have grab and go meals available in all Department of Education schools sites to all students including those attending Explore schools. Grab and go meals will be available at all Explore schools’ locations. Additional information about grab and go meal distribution is below.
Grab and Go Meals
Families can pick up grab and go meals at any DOE school site, including their regular site if attending a charter in district space or their nearest neighborhood district school.
Other relevant information:
Breakfast and lunch will be available for grab and go from 7:30am-1:30pm.
Grab and go meals will distributed by a school food staff member OR by a safety agent.
The grab and go meals will be distributed at the main building entrance OR in the cafeteria.
Students will only be able to pick up one day’s worth of meals.
Updated March 15th, 2020
Dear Explore Schools Families,
You may have heard recently that the DOE is closing schools and moving to remote learning until at least April 20th. We want to share how this recent decision will impact our school community.
We will implement the plan we shared on Friday. On Monday March 16th & Tuesday March 17th, all of our staff will work remotely with each other and school leaders to set up our Continued Learning plan. We will launch the plan on the morning of Wednesday March 18th. We will follow the DOE’s timeline and remain remote until at least April 20th. Beginning Wednesday March 18th, you can access Explore Schools continued learning site by visiting: Explore Schools Continuing Education Website for more detailed instructions to access work.
Updated March 13th, 2020
Dear Explore Schools Families,
After significant consideration and planning, we have decided to close all Explore Schools campuses on Monday, 3/16, and Tuesday, 3/17, in order for staff to begin planning for a possible longer-term school closure relating to COVID-19 (the novel Coronavirus). During this time, staff will be working to create and set up materials so that your child can continue learning from home.
On Wednesday, 3/18, your child will either (1) return to school or (2) begin home based learning because of school closures. If school is closed, we ask that you support your child with independent continued learning while the school building is closed. Your child should be spending 4-5 hours per day doing educational activities, with teachers available by phone and email to support with questions and to give feedback. Please be aware that your child’s daily “attendance” and work submission is required, and that missing work will detrimentally impact your child’s grade.
Please go online and visit: Explore Schools Continuing Education Website for more detailed instructions for families to access work.
We ask that you check your emails and calls so that you are kept up to date.
Updated March 10th, 2020
Dear Explore Schools Community,
We have spent the last few weeks actively monitoring the coronavirus (COVID-19) and planning a response for any potential impact to our community. We will continue to closely monitor the situation and provide updates and resources to our school community here on our website.
Resources
Explore Schools Families Resources
Explore Schools Continued Learning Website
The website linked below houses materials to ensure that your child continues to learn in the event of a school closure. Instructions to access the content for your child’s class are included on the site.
Explore Schools Continuing Education Website
Explore Schools Family Communications – Family Communications
Family Frequently Asked Questions – Family FAQs
Coronavirus (COVID-19) Fact Sheets – Fact Sheets
Other Resources
Food Assistance Information for School Closures
https://portal.311.nyc.gov/site-finder/
https://www.hungervolunteer.org/food-map
https://www.hungerfreeamerica.org/neighborhood-guides-food-assistance
New York City Department of Education (NYCDOE) – https://www.schools.nyc.gov/school-life/health-and-wellness/coronavirus-update
To stay updated via text alerts from NYC, families can text COVID to 692-692 to opt in.
Center for Disease Control (CDC) – https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/index.html
New York State Department of Health (DOH) – https://www.health.ny.gov/diseases/communicable/coronavirus/
DOH Novel Coronavirus Hotline – Call 1-888-364-306
Preparing for COVID-19 – https://www.health.ny.gov/diseases/communicable/coronavirus/prepare.htm
NYC Small Business Services – Assistance & guidance for businesses impacted due to novel coronavirus: https://www1.nyc.gov/site/sbs/businesses/covid19-business-outreach.page
Contact Us
Phone:
(718) 989-6730
E-mail:
information@explorenetwork.org
Mail:
Explore Schools
20 Jay Street, Suite 211
Brooklyn, NY 11201
